file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-26-03-05 - SINGLE IRU FAN - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SINGLE IRU FAN - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational test of the Single IRS unit fan. B. The Single IRS unit fan is installed on the IRS unit mounting tray. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY SINGLE IRS UNIT FAN - OPERATIONAL ALL 34-26-03-700-801-A TEST EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-26-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-26-03-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SINGLE IRS UNIT FAN - OPERATIONAL TEST A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the Single IRS unit fan operational test. (2) The Single IRS unit fan is installed on the IRS unit mounting tray. (3) The Single IRS unit tray is installed on the left side of the forward electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-26-01-000-801-A/400 INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT (IRU) - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-26-01-400-801-A/400 INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT (IRU) - INSTALLATION S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Forward electronic compartment - LH 213 113CZ upper side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit/Forward electronic compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 34-26-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the IRS circuit breaker. (2) On the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (striped bar comes on). (3) For aircraft PRE-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (4) For aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, install safety pin of the NLG-door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (5) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU HANDLE THE IRS UNIT. (6) Remove the Inertial Reference Unit from the mounting tray ( AMM TASK 34-26-01-000-801-A/400). (7) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Test Procedure (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the IRS circuit breaker. (2) Make sure that the Single IRS unit fan is operational and that the wind direction is from the fan to the computer. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the IRS circuit breaker. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the Inertial Reference Unit to the mounting tray again ( AMM TASK 34-26-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Close access panel 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) For aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, remove the safety pin from the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close the IRS circuit breaker. (5) On the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (striped bar comes off). (6) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 34-26-03 Page 3 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
